summary: Expressive arts program leader and mentor with experience designing curricula, supervising large teams, and delivering trauma-informed interventions for youth; skilled in CBT/DBT, mindfulness, and developmental psychology.

experience.title: EXPRESSIVE ARTS PROGRAM LEADER
experience.description: Formulated, proposed, and was authorized to implement "The Arts Project," a weekly therapeutic, expressive arts program for 10+ "at- risk" CPS middle school students residing in a low-income urban neighborhood. The Arts Project incorporates methods from evidence-informed therapeutic interventions to enhance social/emotional skills, self-esteem, grit, self-control & regulation, and to reduce stereotype threat.

experience.title: Curriculum Designer / Program Facilitator
experience.description: Designed & delivered curriculum for weekly coping skills sessions with groups of 20-50 early adolescents & their mentors; tailored sessions to address unique risk factors faced by our youth (e.g. community violence, chronic poverty, school dropout); integrated therapeutic approaches from various evidence-based practices (DBT, CBT, Mindfulness-based Stress Reduction); produced & administered usability, feasibility, and satisfaction forms; evaluated and amended curriculum based on feedback.

experience.title: MENTOR SUPERVISION TEAM LEADER & SUPERVISOR
experience.description: Developed measures and organized platforms for more than 50 mentors to report contact with mentee; conducted thorough interviews with potential mentors, youth participants, and parents of youth in the mentoring intervention to arrange meaningful and lasting youth-mentor relationships; supervised up to 8 mentor-mentee pairs at a time; coordinated with teachers and parents to assess needs and establish protective resources; organized weekly meetings with each supervisee to problem-solve and address conflicts.

experience.title: TEACHING ASSISTANT
experience.description: Over the course of 6 academic terms, promoted engaging discussions, critical thinking, and a warm learning environment for groups of 50-60 undergraduate students enrolled in PSY-305; selected as Head Teaching Assistant of the course for 2013-14.

education.degree: Master of Science in General Psychology (Clinical Child)
Bachelor of Arts in General Psychology and Human Development

certifications: Safe Zone Allies Training & BUILD Diversity Certification - DePaul University
TF-CBT & CTG adaptation Certificate (childhood traumatic grief) (Web)
Collaborative Institutional Training Initiative (CITI): Human Subjects
